comment._content: Yes, this really is from a glass negative. You can see the crack very clearly in this photo!
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 57099931@N05
comment._content: Brunswick Street (now Sarsfield Street) was named after the British Royal Family at that time. After the death of Queen Anne (a Stuart) in 1714 the crown passed by Act of Settlement to George the First, who was Elector of Hanover. When he ascended to the throne he was styled "King of Great Britain, France and Ireland, Duke of Brunswick - Luneburg and Defender of the Faith".

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: Thanks for this info on the origins of this street name and for giving us the modern name for it too. Always handy to know what streets are actually called today!
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
